intro: Chenopodium stramoniifolium, commonly known as prickly goosefoot, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and has a sprawling growth habit. The plant features alternate, ovate to triangular leaves with serrated margins and a rough texture. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in dense, terminal spikes, and it produces oblong, three-angled seeds. It is often found in arid and semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in poor soil conditions.
